Accessibility.html:
Overview

Momentum has keyboard operation built into all of its components, improving the experience for visually impaired users and other users who operate using the keyboard.

Screen Reader

A spinner will have the Aria role="status". It should also contain assisting label for the screen reader that explains what is currently happening. Because there are no visible lable, use the aria-labelledby=‚ÄúLoading‚Äù

Visible Label, Structural Role and Functional Role not applicable

Spec.html:
Anatomy

Layout

Layout the component and annotate it with redlines denoting size and spacing. Also show what options of the component are optional.

Sizing

There are 4 different size variations to fit different use cases.
Small: 16px by 16px, Default: 32px by 32px, Medium: 44px by 44px, Large: 72px by 72px.

Spacing

Spacing

Small spinner should have minimum of 2px padding around the component

Default spinner

Default spinner should have minimum of 4px padding around the component.

Medium spinner

Medium spinner should have minimum of 12px padding around the component.

Large spinner

Large spinner should have minimum of 16px padding around the component.

Guideline.html:
Usage

Spinners are used when performing actions cause by the user. Spinner use animation to capture attention and inform users of an activity‚Äôs progress. Spinner should be applied to all instances of a process (such as loading) in a consistent format.

Types

Started

Shows the beginning state of the progress start

3/4

Shows the beginning state of the 3/4 loaded.

Completed

Shows upon completed loading process

Failed

Display when there is an error during the loading process.

Sizes

There are four size types of of spinner to accommodate different use cases.

Small

16px by 16px
Mostly used inside a component.

Default

32px by 32px
Used inside a component, such as cards, modals etc. Most commonly used.

Medium

44px by 44px
Used to accommodate cases where bigger spinner is needed.

Large

72px by 72px
Used mostly for full page loading, or larger page real estate.

Behavior

Determinate & Indeterminate

Circular progress indicators support both determinate and indeterminate processes. Determinate circular indicators fill the invisible, circular track with color, as the indicator moves from 0 to 360 degrees. Indeterminate

Content Guidance

Label (Optional)

Use a label to add extra context to the situation for the user. Use an ellipsis at the end of the label text to communicate that the process is in progress (i.e. Loading... or Deleting...)
The text should appear below or to the left (in Left to Right languages).
All spinner label text should use sentence case.

Dos and Dont‚Äôs

Use Appropriate size

Use appropriate size for smaller spaces such as card, list menu, input etc.

Make sure the spinners are not too big or too small

Spinner should not replace 3 dot loader

3 dot loaders are default in the Control Hub Cards component.

Spinners should not replace 3 dot loaders.

Usable Example

Related Components

Progress Bar

Progress bar inform users about the status of on-going process.
